quote_first: “I just took all the pills in the bathroom cabinet,” she says. “Sixty-two aspirin with codeine, twenty-four Valiums. I thought you might like to say goodbye.” “That was stupid, Martha,” Nate says. “Did you really?” “Wait and see,” she says, laughing. “Wait till
quote_last: when you get to inspect the body.”
title: Life Before Man
author: Margaret Atwood

quote_last: that morning, as the reader will remember; but bah! there is no such thing as fatigue on Sunday, said Favourite; on Sunday fatigue does not work.
title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo

quote_first: It was in the township of Dunwich, in a large and hardly inhabited farmhouse set against a hillside 4 miles from the village and a mile and a half from any other dwelling, that Wilbur Whately was born at
quote_last: on Sunday, 2 February, 1913. The date was recalled because it was Candlemas, which people in Dunwich curiously observe under another name.
title: The Dunwich Horror
author: H.P. Lovecraft

quote_last: . Then sprang before the hills. Like hindered rubies, or the light. A sudden musket spills
title: The Day Came Slow, Till Five O' Clock
author: Emily Dickinson
